name: An operating system (OS) is a software program that manages computer hardware and software resources and provides services to computer programs. It acts as an intermediary between computer applications and the computer hardware, providing an interface for software to interact with the hardware. The operating system controls the allocation of resources such as memory, processing power, and storage, and ensures that these resources are used efficiently and effectively. In this blog, we will explore the basics of operating systems and their importance in the modern computing world.
